course.subject: HUMA
course.name: Unofficial China: Social History 1800s-1930s
course.description: A study of the key issues in the social history of late-Imperial and Modern China. Different aspects of ordinary people's life are highlighted in order to critically analyze the process of social change from an unofficial perspective. Topics include: violence in Chinese culture and society, conditions and situation of women, the problems of prostitution, opium smoking and gambling, workers and peasants in face of economic exploitation.

reviews.author: Hot soy milk
reviews.title: Not recommend tho the content sounds interesting
reviews.comment_content:
The professor did insisted that he could not go through all the contents listed in the syllabus. However, I did not expect he taught that slowly, ONE MONTH ONE CHAPER. Yet the final exam covers all the topics tho he said he would lenient if we choose to answer questions on workers, opium and prostitution.

Therefore if you think the content is interesting, I recommend you can audit the course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor taught SUPER SLOW...

We spent more than a month on the first topic (> 1/3 semester ). Someone may say professor was trying to teach in depth ma. But  in my perspective, professor just used 10 examples to illustrate the same argument in 2/3 lectures... Basically he was stuck in the same content over a week.

That is why he can only cover 2 topics (violence and women) more comprehensively. The prostitution, opium and workers, he just rush through all the topic without giving in-depth explanation.


USELESS TA...
We have tutorial which we were required to share our insight based on the reading material. Tho the professor said that each leader who could first speak up should only make a speech no more than 5 mins. But I saw some of my classmates made a 10 mins, even 15 mins speech. And the TA DID NOT STOP THEM... As a result, ta fail to act as a time keeper.

Apart from that, some student may mix up with some concepts. However, the ta never gave them any feedback.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is lenient. However, you will never know your score in tutorial and final.
reviews.comment_workload:
Super heavy... We need to prepare tutorial and final exam.

The tutorial requires you to go through the reading and give your insight in response to the questions raised by the TAs. The reading can be over 80 pages. Sometimes the gap between each tutorial is only 8-9days....

Final exam consist of 4 essay questions. You need to finish writing two essay in 3 hours. As you can copy all prof said in your one-page cheat sheet, no need to recite any stuff for the final this time.

reviews.author: Squirtle123
reviews.comment_content:
Week 1: Organisation of the Course & What is “unofficial” history of China?
Weeks 2 & 3: Violence and Society
Weeks 4 & 5: Oppression of Women
Weeks 6 & 7: Women Lives from Different Angles
Weeks 8 & 9: Prostitution
Weeks 10 & 11: Opium Smoking
Weeks 12 & 13: Workers, Peasants, and the Issue of Exploitation

上第一堂嘅時候已經預告過未必教得切所有content, 平時上堂focus係violence, women同prostitution, opium係打風補課用咗大約兩個鐘講書, workers係自己睇readings only
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof份人幾chill有耐性, 教書廣東話/普通話/英文都會用到, 語速正常偏慢, 不過prof唔係好prefer電子嘢 所以冇lecture video/notes/slides, canvas 只會upload syllabus同readings, lecture唔計attendance但係上堂嘅模式係prof口講 學生手寫notes, 所以miss一堂嘅content下堂就未必聽得返, 大部份學生都會attend lecture
reviews.comment_grading:
Tutorial 40% (Attendance 10%, Participation 20%, Leader discussion 10%)
Examination 60%

Tutorial只有四次, 上齊就有10% attendance,  participation都唔算難攞, 每次上tutorial之前都睇一睇readings 同 guiding questions, 等嗰堂tutorial嘅leaders答完就舉手答問題, 我嗰個session大部份學生都有答過3-4次 (throughout 4 tutorials), leader discussion 就係四次tutorial入邊佢會assign你其中一次tutorial要做leader答問題, 通常答案冇話啱定錯,答到就得
Examination 係寫long essay,4揀2,可以帶both sided cheat sheet, essay topic會包晒所有syllabus有寫嘅topic, essay好着重例子

我tutorial 4次都有attend + 參與discussion, examination考完之後覺得自己有偏題, 可能係tutorial拉高返所以overall A-
reviews.comment_workload: 自問覺得workload頗大, 每個topic都有三至四篇readings要睇, 有中有英 有啲篇幅都幾長 , readings主要係tutorial discussion要用, lecture有時會提及, 同埋exam舉例子時可能會用到, 所以唔鍾意睇readings嘅話要諗清楚係咪take呢個course

reviews.author: Testing1234
reviews.title: An interesting course that you dont feel like you're attending a lecture
reviews.comment_content:
Some topics about China violence, woman, prostitution, opium and workers.

Week 1: Organisation of the Course & What is “unofficial” history of China?
Weeks 2 & 3: Violence and Society
Weeks 4 & 5: Oppression of Women
Weeks 6 & 7: Women Lives from Different Angles
Weeks 8 & 9: Prostitution
Weeks 10 & 11: Opium Smoking
Weeks 12 & 13: Workers, Peasants, and the Issue of Exploitation
reviews.comment_teaching: Lol I dont feel like I am having lectures during class. Virgil speaks like an uncle in Victoria Park that you won't feel bored. Although "History" seems to be boring to most people, I'm sure that it wont happen in this class. There is no attendance but many students attended all classes. By the way Virgil doesn't like students using electronic devices during class or leaving in the middle without saying anything. Therefore many of us printed the required readings out and jot notes.
reviews.comment_grading:
Tutorial 40%: Attendance (10%) + participation in tutorials (20%) + leading discussion (10%)

Starting from the middle of the semester, there will be tutorials every 2 weeks. In total there will be 4 tutorials. Everyone has to be the section leader once (there will be 4-5 leaders each session) and they will have to give a speech for 5-7 minutes based on the required readings and questions in the beginning of each section. After all leaders' speeches, the remaining students can raise your hands and speak up. Remember you will be graded by your active participation, so RAISE YOUR HAND AND ANSWER IN EVERY SECTION.

Examination 60%
There will be 4 essay type questions and you have to answer 2 of them. This year we can bring a two sided A4 cheatsheet, and I wrote everything Virgin said during class (probably most of us do so). The exam lasts for 3 hours therefore try to write as much as you can.

Overall I got an A-. To be honest I thought I could get an A, but A- is still good for me.
reviews.comment_workload: You have to read some articles/ essays/ reports/ books before each tutorial. They are pretty much so I recommend start reading them earlier, like 2-3 days before the tutorial. On average you have to read 3-4 for each tutorial, and you better understand them cleary and have a good speech in the tutorial.

reviews.author: 科大黃金船
reviews.title: 講述暴力、嫖娼、毒品同女性地位嘅近代歷史course
reviews.comment_content:
開門見山，成個course content同你高中有無讀過中史0關係，利申無讀。

Add drop period第一個禮拜會好籠統甘介紹一次上述近代中國黃賭毒（其實就無賭博）嘅歷史，但Virgil伯伯會特別指明尼d歷史背後有d乜扭曲同偏見，跟著係後面兩三個月逐一舉例反駁。

理想中會cover嘅Topic：
1. 頭兩個個禮拜教中國文化暴唔暴力
2. 兩個禮拜教中國女性係古代有咩地位同待遇，而引申出下一個Topic
3. 兩個禮拜教近代叫雞史
4. 兩個禮拜教鴉片史並帶到講少少鴉片戰爭歷史，但focus係講中國人點食鴉片嘅歷史。
5. 最後教埋中國工人到底有無係近代受壓迫

現實：最後工人Topic教唔切 因爲每次Virgil伯伯都太投入講得好detail搞到遲落堂，更何況追進度。不過係最後4堂會recap同補充之前tutorial我地讀過嘅野。

五個Topic都有readings要睇，上堂你預五堂講完一個Topic嘅readings就算快架啦

Tutorial：Total 4次，一次俾3-4篇readings同1-2條問題你，睇完based on readings present講自己嘅讀後感，你見解獨到可以自己揾埋其他史料補充。你join tutorial就送分，有講野就再多d分，肯去肯講野就夠（即使係recap readings d野都得）

Tips：Virgil伯伯每次比得你嘅readings未必全部係support教緊嘅Topic，有d係正有d係反，你有自己觀點嘅，可以自行批判你睇唔順眼嘅readings就得（當然最好用返上堂教過嘅史實）。

唔洗attendance，但你唔上堂就聼唔到要寫d乜notes，好自爲之，你自認好瞭解中國傳統文化、中國傳統女性、中國嘅古代叫雞業、中國近代工廠d工人等等，可以走堂跟著係Tutorial同Final再講下你有乜高見。
reviews.comment_teaching:
無ppt同埋notes少到可以忽略。

上堂回歸原始：Virgil伯伯講，你抄，完。講幾多就出幾多，份final基本上就係問你佢上堂就住尼幾個Topic講過d乜point有d乜證據可以寫。

有人唔習慣 有人無所謂 明嘅。不過尼年2640係online教，可以用電腦打字記notes對我黎講就輕鬆d。現場f2f你就預堂堂手抄啦，btw，記得印d readings出黎帶去上堂，或者你用ipad都得。

佢講d point全部建基係對宜家d人對中國傳統文化、中國傳統女性、中國嘅古代叫雞業、中國近代工廠等等嘅誤解或者係無知，但Virgil伯伯可以做到客觀而又具有批判性，所謂客觀係指你能夠用客觀嘅證據支持你主觀嘅論點，而Virgil係堂堂都有充足史料教比大家，包括但不限於舊報紙、舊相、歷史文獻、自述傳記、統計學數據等。

另外，佢歡迎各位反駁或補充佢嘅歷史觀點或提供史實資料。
reviews.comment_grading:
*Tutorial同Final都無出分，而且出grade數一數二慢。
Tutorial 4成
Final 6成

Final 4條題，揀兩條答。我地果年online教就考5個鐘寫兩條題。唔洗嚴格到essay級別 open book寫兩篇文就完。份final基本上就係問你佢上堂就住尼幾個Topic講過d乜point有d乜證據，你當然可以寫曬落去，但我無寫曬lol，不過有加d私料落去，同埋你鍾意用中文，英文，廣東話寫都得。

Final grade：A+，final我係用中文寫，Tutorial上齊同肯講野。
reviews.comment_workload:
Tutorial 4堂 你要join同講readings嘅讀後感（相當於1/3個present，但其實每次其實唔洗講超過一分鐘已經有分）。

係，睇Tutorial d readings已經食你每個禮拜兩三個鐘頭（包埋查字典，因爲中英readings都有），你讀得二字頭huma預左架啦。

上堂d readings睇完相對性價比就高d 早死早著 兩三個睇完一個Topic嘅readings（3-4篇有中有英）可以聼Virgil教三個禮拜有多。

跟著間唔中整合下上堂抄過d notes，甘又食走兩個鐘，考試based on你d notes去揀邊條final合心水，答就完。

reviews.author: Q20
reviews.comment_content:
Another side of the modern history of china taught in English but studied in Chinese (you'll need to read a lot of literature).

Just as the intro says, this course is all about violence, women, prostitution, the opium war and the 'overexploitation' in China. As he mentioned, if you have enrolled to his previous course (also about China history, but idk which), this course would be nicer. But me as a Yr 1 didn't attend so and without HKDSE ChiHis bg, still think the content is manageable, except for lack of deep understanding on specific topics. It is still meaningful if you just want to make a preliminary step to study ChiHis.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Local, talkative prof. and informative class. However, he seems to talk about something (might not be main points or very meaningful, lol) repetitively so he didn't manage to go through all the content on class in this semester.

No matter what, we don't have to attend all the lectures this sem due to zoom teaching. I guess when you read enough/ most of the literature, it will be more than enough for you to understand what he wants to express. (but of course, could say his teaching helps you to skip reading some of the literature, so this depends on you).
reviews.comment_grading:
What is counted:
-Final exam where you write passages on the topics chosen from his question list within ~6 hours
-4 discussions(tutorials)

attendance is not counted in the % this sem.

The grading is fair.
reviews.comment_workload: There are 4 tutorials (replacing one of the lecture) every other week. Each is for you and your classmates to discuss on parts of 2~3 literature (provided by the prof) regarding the course's topic e.g. women. No additional homework is assigned but you of course have to read most of the course material for the tutorial. Try not to spend too much time on delving into some terms (like me LOL), instead, drop down your idea/inspiration/conclusion on some parts of the literature and make sure to understand its overall idea. This is more than enough to prepare for the tutorials and final exam.
